data.title: All of Me
data.meta_description: Must close June 16! “All of Me makes you laugh uproariously one moment and gives you a lump in your throat the next.” —Frank Scheck, NyStage Review   It’s your classic romantic comedy. Boy meets girl. Boy uses a wheelchair, girl uses a scooter, and they both use text-to-speech technology to connect to the world […]
data.text:
Performance take place April 23 – June 16, 2024. Opening Night is Tuesday, May 14.

Performances begin April 23, 2024

Weekly Schedule: Tuesday – Friday at 7:30pm, Saturdays at 2pm and 8pm, and Sundays at 2pm.

Performance Schedule subject to change

All of Me Talkbacks & Engagement Events:

The New Group is happy to share the multiple talkback and special events happening around the upcoming production of All Of Me. Each event is meant to increase accessibility while enhancing the experience of the show.

Engagement Event – Masked Performance

Date: Wednesday, May 1 at 7:30pm

All Of Me offers a special Masks Required performance where all audience members will be required to wear a mask. Masks will be available at the box office.

Talkback – Change Is In The Air: Accessibility in Theater

Date: Thursday, May 2, following the 7:30pm performance.

This post-show talkback will feature a discussion on the creative process of All of Me, and the growth and changes that have helped make theater more accessible for this production and within the industry. Speakers will include accessibility and disability consultant Paul Behrhorst, co-founder of ConsultAbility, and All of Me Associate Director Evan T Cummings.

Engagement Event – ASL Performance and Town Hall Conversation

Date: Thursday, May 16 at 7:30pm with Town Hall to follow the performance

The New Group is proud to announce the return of ASL Interpreted performances. Following the show, audience members are invited to participate in a town hall conversation to share their observations and concerns about accessibility in theater with industry professionals. ASL interpretation will be available for both performance and town hall conversation.

Talkback – Page to Stage: The Evolution of All of Me

Date: Tuesday, May 21, following the 7:30pm performance

This post-show talkback will feature a conversation with playwright Laura Winters and director Ashley Brooke Monroe about the creation, history and development of bringing All Of Me to the stage.

Engagement Event – Open Caption Performances

Dates: Thursday, May 23 at 7:30pm and Saturday, June 8th at 2pm

The New Group will offer two Open Caption Performances. Captioning will be done by c2 (Caption Coalition), and is provided through funds from TDF’s TAP grant program.

Engagement Event & Talkback – Date Night!

Date: Saturday, June 1 at 6:30pm

Love is in the air at All Of Me and this special date night experience is no exception! Guests attending the show will have the opportunity to upgrade their ticket to include a date night Dance Class at 6:30pm, just prior to the performance. The hour-long dance class is led by Cathleen Terrando, Co-Founding Director of Roll Call Wheelchair Dance Long Island. Reservations required; space for the dance class is limited. After the show, all audience members are welcome to stay for a talkback about the love story in the play and the history of romantic comedies.

Can’t make it to this “Date Night” event? To add a little romance to each performance, The New Group is teaming up with The Green Fig to offer a special “date night package.” When purchasing tickets, you’ll be able to add-on dinner for two at The Green Fig (570 Tenth Avenue) for $99. This includes a shared appetizer, two entrees and a shared dessert. Tax and gratuity are included.

Talkback – LatinX Theater: Representation on the Stage

Date: Tuesday, June 4 following the 7:30pm performance

This post-show conversation dives into the representation of the Latinx community in All Of Me and in theater today.

Engagement Event & Talkback – Caregivers Day

Date: Saturday, June 8 at 2pm

To celebrate the caregivers in our lives, The New Group is offering free child care by Parent Artist Advocacy League (PAAL) and Broadway Babysitters will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis in one of The Signature Center Studios while adults enjoy the show. To reserve childcare, fill out this form (also located in our purchase pathway for the 2pm performance on June 8).

Engagement Event – Audio Described Performance

Date: Sunday, June 9 at 2pm

At this performance, the visual action on stage will be described live through audio devices. Audience members can reserve audio devices in advance via the ticket pathway for pick up at the box office prior to the show. Live Audio Description provided by Laura H. Congleton. Please note, some audio description may be heard throughout the house during this performance.

Engagement Event – Relaxed Performance

Date: Wednesday, June 12 at 7:30pm

We welcome the audience to a relaxed performance of All Of Me. For this performance, house lights will remain on at a slightly dimmed level, and on-stage lights and sound levels will be adjusted to less bright and less sudden occurrences. A sensory guide will be available for patrons ahead of the performance.
